revised_title: Transmission of Sunlight Through the Earth: A Study of Color Photometry
tldr: The author conducted a series of experiments to study the transmission of sunlight through the Earth's atmosphere. They used color photometry to measure the intensity of sunlight and found that the color composition of sunlight varies depending on the location and atmospheric conditions. The author also compared their observations with those made at high altitudes and found that the atmospheric conditions at lower altitudes affect the transmission of sunlight.
